Hi Balaji,

The ANT JUnit task does write everything you output to the TEST=
*.xml files.
So you could measure the Oracle Time in your tests, and write =
it to System.out.

At that time it is available in the XML files, but the J=
UnitReport task does not write the log info to the HTML file.
You will have=
 to customize the stylesheets that ANT uses to convert XML to HTML.

I have=
 done this before, but to generate PDF with logs=C2=A0in stead of HTML: htt=
p://junitpdfreport.sourceforge.net/managedcontent/

You can have a look at =
the stylesheet on how to retrieve and render the System.out logs:
http://ju=
nitpdfreport.cvs.sourceforge.net/junitpdfreport/src/resources/report/themes=
/default/junit-noframes.xsl?view=3Dmarkup

Regards, Jan



=C2=A0

 Original Message ----
From: balajiora <balajiora@...>
To: junit@yaho=
ogroups.com

ustomizing JUnit HTML Report


Hi, 

In my project currently I am using JUn=
it to generate the HTML Test Case 
Report. In the HTML Report under the Met=
hod Details Section, Currently 
its displaying the method name, status, typ=
e and Time (Execution time 
of each method - Test Case). 

My customer want=
s few modification in the HTML Report. In my test case 
method, I am connec=
ting to Oracle DB and executing a procedure. I am 
logging the procedure ex=
ecution time in log file. But customer wants 
to see the execution time in =
JUnit HTML Report. Like Method Name, 
Status, Oracle Execution Time, Test C=
ase Time. 

Could you please suggest me, What I can do to meet this expecta=
tion? 
Waiting for your reply. 

Regards
Balaji S
